message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GR. 

The paper deals with the computation of common tangents of two disjoint polygons, which is a problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The algorithm presented in the paper has a linear time complexity and constant workspace, which suggests that it involves efficient data structures and algorithms. Hence, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions that the set of common tangents provides information about the convex hulls of the polygons, which suggests that it involves some aspects of discrete mathematics, such as combinatorics and graph theory. Therefore, cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) is another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions that the algorithm decides the relationship between the convex hulls of the polygons, which suggests that it involves some aspects of computational complexity theory. Hence, cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is another likely sub-category. Finally, the paper also mentions that the algorithm has practical applications in computer graphics and robotics, which suggests that it involves some aspects of computer graphics and robotics. Therefore, cs.GR (Computer Graphics) is another likely sub-category.
